text: The men's lightweight quadruple sculls competition at the 2018 World Rowing Championships in Plovdiv took place at the Plovdiv Regatta Venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Monday 10 September 2018 || 10:18 || Heats |- | Wednesday 12 September 2018 || 11:57 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Friday 14 September 2018 || style=background:lemonchiffon| 12:30 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |- | 15:03 || Final B |} All times are Eastern European Summer Time (UTC+3) ==Results== ===Heats=== Heat winners advanced directly to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Florian Roller Moritz Moos Max Röger Joachim Agne | align="left"| | 5:50.44 | FA |- | 2 | align="left"|Mert Kartal Bayram Sönmez Fatih Ünsal Enes Kuşku | align="left"| | 5:53.75 | R |- | 3 | align="left"|Peter Csiszar Balázs Fiala Bence Tamás David Forrai | align="left"| | 5:56.21 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Frederik Taulbjerg Jonas Lund Jens Graudal Christian Hagemann | align="left"| | 5:56.36 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Alexander Loy Samuel Hausmann Michael Landuyt James Nelson | align="left"| | 6:02.13 | R |- | 6 | align="left"|Mohamed Abderraouf Djouimai Boucif Mohammed Belhadj Kamel Ait Daoud Sid Ali Boudina | align="left"| | 6:13.21 | R |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Catello Amarante Paolo Di Girolamo Andrea Micheletti Matteo Mulas | align="left"| | 5:48.03 | FA |- | 2 | align="left"|Jiří Kopáč Jan Vetešník Milan Viktora Jan Cincibuch | align="left"| | 5:53.39 | R |- | 3 | align="left"|Fintan McCarthy Ryan Ballantine Jacob McCarthy Andrew Goff | align="left"| | 5:53.43 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Didrik Wie- Soltvedt Oskar Sødal Jens Holm Lars Benske | align="left"| | 5:59.80 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Pablo Perianes Alejandro Vera Manel Balastegui Jesús González | align="left"| | 6:01.89 | R |} ===Repechages=== The two fastest boats in each repechage advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Repechage 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Mert Kartal Bayram Sönmez Fatih Ünsal Enes Kuşku | align="left"| | 5:51.12 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Fintan McCarthy Ryan Ballantine Jacob McCarthy Andrew Goff | align="left"| | 5:54.09 | FA |- | 3 | align="left"|Didrik Wie- Soltvedt Oskar Sødal Jens Holm Lars Benske | align="left"| | 5:58.57 | FB |- | 4 | align="left"|Alexander Loy Samuel Hausmann Michael Landuyt James Nelson | align="left"| | 6:03.66 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Mohamed Abderraouf Djouimai Boucif Mohammed Belhadj Kamel Ait Daoud Sid Ali Boudina | align="left"| | 6:07.67 | FB |} ====Repechage 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Frederik Taulbjerg Jonas Lund Jens Graudal Christian Hagemann | align="left"| | 5:51.80 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Jiří Kopáč Jan Vetešník Milan Viktora Jan Cincibuch | align="left"| | 5:54.29 | FA |- | 3 | align="left"|Peter Csiszar Balázs Fiala Bence Tamás David Forrai | align="left"| | 5:56.67 | FB |- | 4 | align="left"|Pablo Perianes Alejandro Vera Manel Balastegui Jesús González | align="left"| | 5:59.31 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the B final. ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Pablo Perianes Alejandro Vera Manel Balastegui Jesús González | align="left"| | 6:05.13 |- | 2 | align="left"|Didrik Wie- Soltvedt Oskar Sødal Jens Holm Lars Benske | align="left"| | 6:07.07 |- | 3 | align="left"|Peter Csiszar Balázs Fiala Bence Tamás David Forrai | align="left"| | 6:07.25 |- | 4 | align="left"|Alexander Loy Samuel Hausmann Michael Landuyt James Nelson | align="left"| | 6:10.88 |- | 5 | align="left"|Mohamed Abderraouf Djouimai Boucif Mohammed Belhadj Kamel Ait Daoud Sid Ali Boudina | align="left"| | 6:22.64 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Joachim Agne Max Röger Florian Roller Moritz Moos | align="left"| | 5:51.21 |- | | align="left"|Catello Amarante Paolo Di Girolamo Andrea Micheletti Matteo Mulas | align="left"| | 5:52.85 |- | | align="left"|Mert Kartal Bayram Sönmez Fatih Ünsal Enes Kuşku | align="left"| | 5:53.95 |- | 4 | align="left"|Frederik Taulbjerg Jonas Lund Jens Graudal Christian Hagemann | align="left"| | 5:55.69 |- | 5 | align="left"|Fintan McCarthy Ryan Ballantine Jacob McCarthy Andrew Goff | align="left"| | 5:56.64 |- | 6 | align="left"|Jiří Kopáč Jan Vetešník Milan Viktora Jan Cincibuch | align="left"| | 5:59.77 |} ==References== Category:2018 World Rowing Championships
title: 2018 World Rowing Championships – Men's lightweight quadruple sculls
